Uses of Package
org.klotski.graphics

Packages that use org.klotski.graphics
Package
Description
org.klotski.coding
This package contains classes that are full of practical code but there is not the graphical part.
They collaborate between them and with Graphics classes.
For example BoardImp can create Board following the Creator design pattern.
They are used also by Controller,
which is full of classes that work as a link between some Graphics and this package
org.klotski.controller
This package contains Controller classes, that are useful to do few but optimized things
These classes are designed to work as a link between Window and Coding classes.
To use this package at the best possible, is it preferable to call these classes and relative function inline.
In fact, every class has one or more methods that can be called to do a specific action.
org.klotski.graphics
This package contains graphical classes for displaying Klotski Game.
They work well together thanks to Window class,
that places every piece and calls the right Controller of Controller package.
Block is inside Board that is inside Window.
LoginPage works as a stand-alone class to collect and show username before game starting.
  • Classes in org.klotski.graphics used by org.klotski.coding
    Class
    Description
    Block
    Class Block that extends JPanel to set graphical pieces for basics elements in Klotski.
  • Classes in org.klotski.graphics used by org.klotski.controller
    Class
    Description
    Board
    Class Board that extends JPanel to set graphical game board for Klotski game.
    Window
    This is the main Graphical Class that connect all the Coding Classes with all the Graphics Classes.
    It does not access and calls methods from other Graphics or Coding.
    It extends JFrame to set Frame parameters and implements various Listeners.
    Thanks to them, Window is able to call Controllers handling the Events.
    It only instantiates every object and calls every controller in the right situation, handling various Listeners.
    It is important to make Window it visible,
    after it becomes instantiated, and to save the game with the right command.
    For example:
  • Classes in org.klotski.graphics used by org.klotski.graphics
    Class
    Description
    Board
    Class Board that extends JPanel to set graphical game board for Klotski game.
